page.title: 15John Thomson (cont.)
page.content:
....team and seemed set for a glourious career.
That career came to an ubrupt end on a bright Saturday afternoon. On the 5th of September 1931 John Thomson made his last save. It was an "old firm game" Celtic v Rangers, the first half had been rather dull and the fans hoped for a more exciting second half. Five minutes into the second half, the ball broke loose to Rangers young center forward Sam English. Sam saw his chance, but John Thomson was alert and came off his line, dived at Sam English's feet like a scrum half, and was hit on the head by Sam English's knee. You could have heard a pin drop in the stadium when the fans realised young John was badly hurt. (cont.)
